text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Local council polls originally scheduled for last December now to hold on March 15.

- Police detain former government chief secretary and one time presidential aspirant Olu Falae but silent on reasons. State security operatives meanwhile step up search for suspects in three recent bomb blasts in Lagos.
- Banks, awaiting 1997 fiscal budget, shun first auction of forex this year with only two banks bidding for funds.
- Information minister Walter Ofonagoro alleges that foreign powers are behind spate of bomb attacks in Lagos.
- Political party chiefs endorse new dates for council poll.
- Inflation rate drops to 32.3 percent in November, Federal Office of Statistics predicts 29.7 percent in December.
- Shipping agencies in Nigeria raise handling charges by 30 percent effective January 1, 1997.
